The meal started out great. Outstanding olives and bread were delivered to the table as I just sat down. The olives were among the best I've ever had.  I started with the house made burrata which was very good.  I then had the smoked tuna belly that everyone raves about. It was OK, but not necessarily worth 20 Euros. I was still a bit hungry so I ordered the soup special of the day - cream of cauliflower with caviar on top.  I guess I should have asked the price before ordering - I get the bill and the price of the soup was 40 euros - as much as the entire meal. Note to staff - please post the specials on a blackboard w/ the price, so guests aren't offended when the bill comes.
